com.harrison.lee.twitpic4j
Class TwitPic

java.lang.Object
  com.harrison.lee.twitpic4j.TwitPic

public class TwitPic
extends java.lang.Object

Main class of the twitpic4j library. This class defines methods pertinent to uploading image data to TwitPic.com.

Version:
0.9.0
Author:
Harrison Lee

Method Detail

upload

public TwitPicResponse upload(java.io.File picture)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              TwitPicException
Uploads a file to TwitPic. Twitter will *NOT* be updated when uploading with this function.

Parameters:
picture - The picture file to be uploaded
Returns:
Returns a TwitPicResponse object which encapsulates XML response message from TwitPic.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
TwitPicException

upload

public TwitPicResponse upload(byte[] picture)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              TwitPicException
Uploads an image contained in a byte array to TwitPic. Twitter will *NOT* be updated when uploading with this function.

Parameters:
picture - The picture file to be uploaded
Returns:
Returns a TwitPicResponse object which encapsulates XML response message from TwitPic.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
TwitPicException

uploadAndPost

public TwitPicResponse uploadAndPost(java.io.File picture,
                                     java.lang.String message)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     TwitPicException
Uploads a file to TwitPic. Twitter *WILL* be updated when uploading with this function. The optional parameter 'message' will be posted with the image on TwitPic, and with the link on Twitter. Enter a value of 'null' if no message is desired.

Parameters:
picture -
message -
Returns:
Throws:
java.io.IOException
TwitPicException

uploadAndPost

Uploads an image contained in a byte array to TwitPic. Twitter *WILL* be updated when uploading with this function. The optional parameter 'message' will be posted with the image on TwitPic, and with the link on Twitter. Enter a value of 'null' if no message is desired.
